title: What is the difference between poverty and human poverty? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hey buddy here is ur answer !!!!!! → The traditional measures of poverty are based on the income perspective. → A person is considered to be poor if, and only if, his income level is below the defined poverty line . → Human poverty means the deprivation that people suffer throughout their live. Or POVERTY :- poverty means not having enough money for basic needs for food , clothes and shelter . They have a job but do not earn enough money for basic things . HUMAN POVERTY :- Human poverty means the basic requirements is not getting to satisfy their needs in all issues is known as human poverty .

“The poor are only they who feel poor, and poverty consists in feeling poor. The rich, as we reckon them, and among them the very rich, —in a true scale would be found very indigent and ragged. The great make us feel, first of all, the indifference of circumstances. They call into activity the higher perceptions and subdue the low habits of comfort and luxury; but the higher perceptions find their objects everywhere; only the low habits need palaces and banquets.” (Ralph Waldo Emerson, Domestic life)
